intro: Amauropelta brausei, commonly known as the Brause's shield fern, is a rare and ancient fern species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, shield-shaped fronds that are often covered in a dense layer of hair. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in cloud forests and other moist, tropical habitats. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Amauropelta brausei is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
